newsitem.title: USA: Security Associates says TJS takes stake.
newsitem.headline: Security Associates says TJS takes stake.

text.p: Security Associates International Inc said Monday TJS Partners LP of New York made a $5 million investment in the company consisting of newly issued stock and a convertible subordinated promissory note.
The transaction makes TJS Partners the largest shareholder in Security Associates, with 49 percent of the common shares outstanding.
The note is convertible into common stock of the company if it issues additional common stock in a securities offering or in certain acquisitions.

Proceeds of the transaction were used to acquire all minority interests in the company's operating subsidiaries, including Security Associates Command Centers and the Monitor Service Group, and to repay existing debt.
Separately, Security Associates said it is holding discussions with several banks on a new senior debt facility.

Security Associates operates third-party monitoring centers, acquires and consolidates recurring monthly revenue through the purchase of monitored accounts and provides training programs to its hundreds of dealers.
